Description: Club made of wood carved with two sets of projecting elements at head.
Curator's comments: See John Petherick, Egypt, the Soudan and Central Africa, 1861, p.400: (on the Dor) ‘(their weapons) consisted of bows and arrows, fearfully-barbed lances, and a variety of clubs. Some resembled the mace of the middle ages, whilst others, made of hard wood, were like mushrooms. The edges were firm and sharp, and when employed against an enemy would cleave the skull.’
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev. Dr William Sparrow Simpson
Acquisition notes: Given by the Rev. William Sparrow Simpson, who had acquired it at the sale of the collection of John Petherick.
